website_summaries.verdict: A versatile pick that works for most consumers who want more than just basic car protection but also don't want to break their budgets on a pricier car cover.
pros: Has 3 layers of protection and sizes for sedans up to 264 inches in length
Comes with straps to keep it in place in windy conditions
cons: Material is somewhat thin, and though water-resistant, it's not waterproof
A few gripes from consumers who received an ill-fitting size

customer_reviews.title: IT SCRACHED MY CAR!!!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely thinner than I thought it was going to be but still seems to be water resistant and pretty durable. This car is my baby and I’m terrified it’s going to scratch the paint still but only time will tell. It really does fit my Acura TL perfectly. My review will be updated on how the paint seems after a few months. UPDATE: I had the cover on for a few weeks straight (Taking it off once but washing it before putting the cover back on) IT SCRACHED MY PAINT! My paint was in great condition so I’m extremely disappointed. There are now scraches around the whole body!! I highly recommend you do NOT buy this car cover.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HELD UP TO HURRICANE IRMA IN WESTERN FLORIDA
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe that any cover that isn't custom made and hundreds of dollars could hold up during the recent weather in Florida. I am so impressed and amazed. I am telling ever9! My neighbors have come to ask me about it! One thing, I accidentally popped my trunk without removing cover first and I broke the piece that latches onto your trunk latch...pretty cool huh! But bummin bout that ..my silly mistake...but if your looking for a solid cover and don't have a ton of money..BUY THIS COVER!! You will be very glad you did!!
customer_reviews.author: Torijo

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this car cover YEARS AGO!
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed by this car cover. Fits my Infiniti G35 coupe PERFECTLY. Easy to throw on, even easier to take off, comes with a nice bag that holds the cover when not in use. The cover overall is really soft and does not scratch the paint/finish of the car. Since I park my car in my driveway I constantly have bird poop or tree leaves on my car but now with this car cover my car stays CLEAN (even through rain). I have recommended this to all my friends. I'm kicking myself now - I SHOULD HAVE BOUGHT THIS YEARS AGO!
customer_reviews.author: Deebo

customer_reviews.title: Didnt last
customer_reviews.text: Good at first but flimsy over time especially after rain. Not waterproof. Even dust got in. Didnt last long before my antenna punctured a hole that pretty much increased to a giant hole that left my roof unprotected. Find a waterproof cover.
customer_reviews.author: Jubyloo

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: The description states that this cover will repel moisture and keep your car dry. Though many reviews state the opposite. So I contacted Leader personally and they admitted the cover is merely water resistant and not waterproof, allowing moisture to get thru to your car, thus making the listing description false advertising, and I can not leave a positive review for underhanded business practices. Please Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: michael indre

customer_reviews.title: Secure fit, good fabric quality.
customer_reviews.text: This cover has been doing a great job at keeping my 2011 Acura TSX covered for short periods. The fit was surprisingly snug with a little room to move around if I needed it. I am still giving this a 5 stars because it did exactly what it promised, and the quality seems great for the price I paid. The only thing I would critique would be that the front and rear of the cover are hard to find sometimes, I wish this cover had a more obvious label marking the front - there is indeed a small tag on the inside that states front but it gets lost in the mass of fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Foodie Mama

customer_reviews.title: Not rain resistant/proof, only 1 layer material
customer_reviews.text: *6/27/18 update! Cover is NOT rain proof, barely rain resistant. After a light rain storm the sun came out & I had wet//soaked spots wherever water would travel to runoff! Should not be advertising as "outdoor," unless it doesn't rain or snow where you live. Even though my 1965' Chrysler 4dr is close to 10" shorter than the 1st recommend cover I opted for a little longer just in case. It barely fits, and in the Florida heat it will definitely shrink & get sun beat as well as begin to tear. I am giving one more chance & ordered the biggest sedan cover in today, returning the old one & updating that covers review.
customer_reviews.author: Hurricane Manny

customer_reviews.title: Well made not a rain cover
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this cover for close to a year and it has held up very well. It is intended to be a dust cover and I think also useful for keeping the sun off the paint. In no way will it keep the rain off. Some of the reviews complain about that fact. Good grief! This is a single layer cotton fabric like a tshirt. What t shirt keeps you dry in the rain? Some people... Well made and useful product!
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: This car cover doesn't keep off dust, doesn't keep off water, doesn't completely keep off bird poop. I'm not sure what its purpose is supposed to be! I had to wash the car when I removed the cover because there was so much dust underneath and I had just waxed the car before putting the cover on. It's completely worthless. Mine's now in the trash. The people who like it must be using it in an airtight garage. That would probably work. But for outdoors it's terrible. I'll pay more and get one that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: MTM

customer_reviews.title: Useless for anyone that doesn’t live in the desert.
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my sedan, since it was supposed to protect against “all weather”, and it fit nicely, not too anug, not too loose. After it rained, I noticed this cover was PLASTERED to my car, so when it stopped raining and it was dry out I pulled up the cover to see if their was water leakage and yes this cover DOES NOT even protect against rain. Instead of advertising all weather it should read: protects against sun and leaves but if theres any rain, snow, ice, a breeze, or someone sneezing, our product doesn’t stand up.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last the Summer
customer_reviews.text: Didn't last the Summer. After only three months, the material which was heralded by the product description and other reviews, deteriorated. It is now literally turning to dust. Greatly disappointed as I have purchase others in the same price range which have lasted years. I specifically purchased this one due to its rating.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Did not stand the test of time!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this cover for a little over a year, and it has begun to tear with even the slightest tug. I park my car beneath a carport so I would not say the cover gets a heck of a lot of sun. Also, I had to cut a hole in it so my antenna would fit through, so I was not too happy about that. Overall I would not suggest for outside use, and I do not recommend this product. Pay a little extra and get something that is better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Amazon
customer_reviews.text: It fit my 2015 Kia Optima nice and snug with little worry of it flying off in a Wind Storm. In Arizona we need covers to not only protect our cars from the Sun but also Dust while we crack the Windows when it's Hot, like today -119* outside. We also have Monsoon's which create a lot of Wind which can throw debris around which can scratch the Car. I'm excited to see just how good this holds up during the next Year but even happier that I found it for under 20 bucks, the cover made for Optimas is much more expensive, I look at it like this; I saved 185 dollars.,,,Thank God for Competition bringing down the MAN!!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Tee

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This cover does protect your car, yes. It's length is correct, yes. It's also very cheap compared to a custom fit cover. However since it doesn't fit perfectly, there's some space which allows wind to get under the cover. The velcro scraps are nowhere near strong enough to hold it in and in a moderate wind will blow the cover right off, ripping the scraps. Attempted to contact company for warranty replacement but received no response. water will sometimes collect, but will evaporate through the cover. Dust and things that fell on it will not go through. Bugs will of course crawl up under the cover from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Only used this for a couple of days. As soon as I put it on I noticed how thin it was.. I could see almost straight through to my hood. Color, emblem.. everything. But my fingers were crossed. Well, it rained. Not even that hard and my car was SOAKED as well! I mean, like there was nothing on the car. I couldn't believe it. I thought it might be a little wet considering how thin it is and the fact they DO NOT say its waterproof. Man.. my car was soaked. I highly doubt it offers much protection from the sun
customer_reviews.author: M. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: 69 C10 stepside Covered!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the three ply originally and it was definitely not waterproof. They sent me the six ply and it was 90% waterproof. The first rain nearly feel the bed of my truck up. Had to elevate it with PVC to keep Rain from coming in the bed. I’m pleased with the product. Only 4 stars because the buckle underneath won’t hold, had to tie it. Be sure and measure your truck first. Bigger is better it helps cover the rims, exact fits don’t
customer_reviews.author: Hulk33

customer_reviews.title: Good Cover for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I have a two classic cars that won't fit in my garage, so I keep them under covers. I have purchase expensive/seven-year warranty covers that never seem to last seven years. In my opinion, these inexpensive covers are the way to go. I simply replace them with new covers every couple years, which seems to provide the best protection for the cars. The exterior material is as thick as the expensive versions and that is always the first layer to go. Buying another Leader Accessories Car Cover as I liked the last one.
customer_reviews.author: Pennsyltucky

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! Way better offers on the market for lesss
customer_reviews.text: The "unique Strap and Buckle system included to assist in keeping the cover in place" came without the Strap. One Buckle only. No "Grommet Holes on both sides...that can be used to tie down the Cover". All this info is in the Instructions sheet accompanying the Vehicle Cover; the problem is that this did not coincide with what the Instructions promised should be in the package. This is basically a misshapen piece of material which is hard to distinguish front from back. I tried to use it once and it was so frustrating and a waste of time that I am planning to put it in the garbage. The vendors should be ashamed of thenselves.
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: Scratchy material
customer_reviews.text: It covers my car fine once I get it on...The material is scratchy at best. It is such a pain in the rearend to get on and off that I now have it balled up (yes "balled up" because it's impossible to fold) on the floor in the storage room. I am honestly afraid it will scratch my paint on my car..so to me...money wasted and lesson learned. Once you get it on, it DOES cover you car and I assume protects it from the weather...so maybe this car cover would be good if you had an old classic you want to keep covered for months at a time...and not on and off every day.
customer_reviews.author: Beverley

customer_reviews.title: Improved design and installation
customer_reviews.text: This is a very snug elastic-border car cover. The underside of each corner is equipped with a pair of 2 straps that fasten to each other crosswise hook-and-loop under the bumper. The previous cover disintegrated to shreds (carport parking, no sun) so hopefully this fabric is improved too. That cover was like a bedspread (and you had to tie it on by throwing a line under the car and tying a knot in it) and then slam each side in the cardoor to keep it from lifting off in a breeze. This cover is more like a shower cap, let's hope that it is. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Birdie

customer_reviews.title: Two of the Stars are for Taking Returns
customer_reviews.text: Their refund policy kept this from being a lower rating. Like another review that I now see, but did not prior to purchase, this is not effective if you park under trees and need to keep sap away. If you need this just to keep dust or leaves off, then it would be great. It came in a handy dandy bag. I am sure that I could personally never fold the cover up to fit neatly in it, but it still is handy dandy. It fit well, and was basically everything that I was looking for. Except actually keeping stuff off my car, that is.
customer_reviews.author: CollectionOfAtoms

customer_reviews.title: Good for indoors and short term use only
customer_reviews.text: This would be good for indoor use, outdoor not so much. * Fit: Fit my 2001 Pontiac Trans Am very well. Snug all around. * Quality: Okay for the money spent. Thin, almost see through fabric. * Durability: Installed April 2019 and lasted until about November 2019. It started to tear and I imagine the UV rays broke down the fabric. It turned into a paper like material, falling apart upon touching it. *Final thoughts: Would I buy again? No, not for my outdoor storage application. I could only recommend this if the vehicle/cover would be stored inside or if the cover is only being used for a short duration, not months at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I bought a $50 Kayme cover which was pretty nice. It had mirror pockets and zippers to access the doors. Unfortunately it was too short for the old Caddy so I sent it back and bought this one for $35. The $15 savings wasn't worth it. Its thin fabric without a waterproof layer and tore easily. I'd recommend spending a few more bux. EDIT: This thing was worse than i thought. We just had our first rain. The rain water went right through taking the dust with it so when I pulled it back my car was covered in mud. Zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: A Piatt

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price but don't expect years of outdoor use
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this twice and it's decent for the price. They usually last one New England season before thinning out and tearing. During high winds, this blew off so I bought some cheap tarp clips and used them on both ends to keep it secure over the nose and trunk. I'm going to try a different one to see if it will last a little longer. For the price point, I'm not too disapointed as I've had over 20" of snow on it on the biggest storms. Naturally, if there is ice, it will tear, but snow cleared well.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Looks to be sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item 2 years ago. I have a classic car I want to protect, but although it is garage kept it can get dusty since it is shared space with my workshop. Some dust can be rough and scratch the paint when wiping off and this cover protects the car from all of that. I cannot comment on how well it holds up in rain and the sun, but it has been perfect for me even through hot Chicago summers and cold winters in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Jose G.

customer_reviews.title: Great dust/sun cover at a great price.  Get the bigger size.
customer_reviews.text: This is superb, does a great job keeping sun and dust off. I would not leave it on during rain. The fabric is soft and does not scratch. It has some nice features like straps under, and a bag that is big enough to stuff it all into. My car was near the top limit of a smaller size, but the smaller would not have worked because my performance sedan has larger air-dams in front and back. So go with the bigger size, though it takes a bigger bag to store it.
customer_reviews.author: Modern Talleyrand

customer_reviews.title: Very thin, like toilet paper.
customer_reviews.text: Very thin fabric tears easily Also specs say it will fit a vehicle up to 20.8 ft. My vehicle 17.5 ft and it was very tight. And since the material is so thin, it will rip. It's kind of like a thick toilet paper. Not durable at all... But the company did return my money. That's a very good thing...
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: A good quality cover at a great price......
customer_reviews.text: Good quality cover for the money, Keeps the car clean and free of leaves, etc Easy to use, relatively light weight doesn't seem to scratch the paint Has a draw string to keep it tight although it fits my car ( 1929 Chevrolet 3 window coupe) tight enough that I don't have to use it, Just the elastic bands slide under my bumpers sufficiently to keep it on, even in high Florida thunderstorm winds of 30-35 plus MPH. I bought a size larger than what was recommended, keep that in mind as others have suggested the same Good for 5 stars from me
customer_reviews.author: forbiddenapple

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere, or regret eating your money
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend you look elsewhere for a cover. Got this for a 2015 Honda Civic and it fully covers the vehicle but somehow someway dust still got through and onto my car. But the main reason for this one star review is this cover is very thin and flimsy. I’ve only had it for over a month and it’s ripping apart. No, it didn’t get caught on anything nor did any sharp objects / corners come in contact with the area that ripped it just ripped and sadly I need to find a new cover because this one sucks.
customer_reviews.author: eM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for 2004 Toyota Solara
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for the price of only $26, perfect fit for 2004 Toyota Solara. Like taylor made for this car.
customer_reviews.author: Ye H. Nyunt

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I am a very satisfied customer. It protected my car in the airport open parking lot x2 weeks against nature's elements, wow. It is sturdy and strong. It did not rip at all from my constant pulling and folding. It is easy to assemble and fold on your own. The size was also perfect - it covered the front/back/both sides of my car including the tires, amazing. It is breathable and dust proof. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Not as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This cover was thin one layer, and anything but water resistant. Also, it was supposed to come with a storage bag, but it didn't. The first night we put it on the car (very, very snug fit on Camry XLS) and it rained lightly overnight. When I pulled it off, the car was soaked, the cover was soaked, and I was soaked after trying to take it off the car. Even though it wasn't expensive, it wasn't worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with this cover
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this cover. First, it is porous such that a LOT of dust and pollen find their way through it. Every time I remove it from my car I am shocked at how dusty it appears as a result. Second, the fabric is flimsy and tears very easily. It never occurred to me that a simple car cover could be so ineffective.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Sollitto

customer_reviews.title: Not Even Close to Accurate Size Description
customer_reviews.text: Look at pic attached - bought this cover for my Classic 1967 Ford Fairlane GT while doing some maint requiring my 4 post outdoor lift. The Fairlane is 188.6 inches or a foot shorter than the 200 inches the description indicates as max fitment. What a joke!! Not even close as seen, for this to fit fully over the entire car with room as it should - I would say description should be corrected to around 170" max ........
customer_reviews.author: Madshirt

customer_reviews.title: Good for while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: It seemed so sturdy, and looked good too. But I just researched- I bought this 6 months ago and the top has torn around the antenna. The cover itself seems to be holding up okay under hot sun and occasional rains since it's outside all the time. I've seen car covers that are reinforced in the roof area- especially around the antenna- that would be a good idea. All in all, after I put a patch on it, it should be okay.
customer_reviews.author: K.P.S

customer_reviews.title: Utterly useless after a couple months, go elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I purchased your 3 layer car cover in December of 2019. Initially my car cover worked without issue. About 3 months ago, any light rain soaks straight through onto my car and leaves the entire car wet. The material holding the strap on has torn and is useless. What's the point of a car cover that can't even protect it from water and has a strap dangling off that scratches the car? 3 layers?... What a joke. Would not buy again. I've reached out to Leader accessories to see if they stand behind their 1 year warranty. I will update following any response if I get one.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: good product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: purchased for my BMW 535xi after reading Xle reviews on Xle covers here. I live in SoCal so this is for the hot weather more than any else. I like the material and how it goes over my car, can tie it across the middle underneath. slightly transparent (see pics), the 200" length cover fit my BMW (194" length) snugly - you have to take side mirrors and/or antenna into consideration when purchasing. I think this is a good product for the money. i shall update later on how it lasts etc
customer_reviews.author: Rakesh HS

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2011 Mustang
customer_reviews.text: This is a great car cover. It is not waterproof, and therefore will not protect against rain. If this is what you’re looking for, you wont find it with this car cover. I personally bought this to protect my car from sap from the trees I park under and for this it works FANTASTIC! The price is very reasonable and that is why I give it 5 stars! If you are looking for protection aganst dust and sap, then look no more! Using this on my 2011 Mustang, fit is very good!
customer_reviews.author: JZ707

customer_reviews.title: fit and function
customer_reviews.text: - I purchased this to cover a 1986 Honda CRX and this is the size recommended. - Based on the fit, I could almost fit another car under the same cover. The cover is way to big for this small car and securing the back of the cover under the hatch latch is no easy task. Form fitting this cover is NOT. - I think one could find a cover that better fits and secures than this one.
customer_reviews.author: S. Shoji

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, terrible set of 'instructions', can't return or exchange it after only 60 days.
customer_reviews.text: We received this car cover July 7 2020 and it has already started to come apart at the seams! Cheaply made with terrible instructions on exactly how to put it securely in on the car (even though we bought this cover because the ad said it was for the exact model car we own). We've had it exactly two months but can't return it for a refund, so we're stuck with a defective car cover.
customer_reviews.author: C Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Leaves behind a layer of dust.
customer_reviews.text: This product is generally a good fit for my Tesla Model 3 (a bit loose width wise). However, this is not dust proof, and in fact, leaves behind a thin layer of dust after a couple of weeks of use. And, it even leaves small scratches on the car too, which I think is caused by the Velcro steps. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase. I wanted to write review on my first purchase but now I want to write review to let everyone knows. This car cover is poorly made. It will break or tear up after about 6 months. So I had to stitch it up as you see in the pictures. I’m not gonna but it again. I already tried 2 car covers and both are the same. Very poor quality. I would not recommend to anyone for this car cover.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits size 0 trucks unlike my full figure
customer_reviews.text: The advertised truck length is a little short. This my what 10 pounds of 1964 F100 short bed looks like shoved into a 5 pound truck cover. The last Budget branded cover of the same size looked like a moomoo. It was comfortable and had some spare give for the days I stuffed myself with premium gas and a load in the bed. I am gonna give it a try to see how well it fits tomorrow after stretching a little bit. Maybe it will loosen up a tad.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Covill

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to replace it after 6 - 8 months in FL
customer_reviews.text: This will be the 3rd one I have purchased in the last 2 years, to cover a project car in my driveway from code enforcement. Its inexpensive so I wasn't too disappointed when i had to replace it. I am in south Florida and the car is in direct sunlight and exposed to the elements every day. You can expect it to start drying out and breaking up after approx. 6 months. The last one lasted 8 months and got destroyed with the close call FL had with Isiasis. Not to bad for $40
customer_reviews.author: Daveypoo

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight cover, however, it does not fit!
customer_reviews.text: I like the lightweight material. The purchase arrived as promised and on time, however, it does not fit. Not long enough. The length of my 1969 Chevelle Malibu is 196.6" (rear bumper to front bumper), and the description of this cover cites a length of 200". Problem - From back to front, the product will only cover the taillights and half of the front grill. Will it fully cover from rear bumper to front bumper? Not even close. Unfortunately, I'm not able to use this 200" cover. How do I go about processing an exchange of the 200" cover for a 206" cover?
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Nikad

customer_reviews.title: No more eyesore!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my old Mercedes diesel that I was restoring. I opted for the XL sedan size due to the cars overall length and it fit perfectly. Came vacuum packed and it was kinda fun to slice open and let the air in. Now, the neighbors wont have to look at this old project through the winter...definately worth it. Please remember, be sure to have an idea of how long your vehicle is before placing your order because I can tell you right now, the normal size would not have fit. Hopefully we will see how it holds up through the next couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch P

customer_reviews.title: Breathable to protect against heat trapping...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cover, fits snug on my mustang. What drew me to it is the breathability factor. You've got to be careful with other covers, bc they can actually trap hot air and super heat the car on sunny days. I usually park my car in the sun, as parking under my pine trees resulted in sap galore. The fabric is sturdy. Some reviews have mentioned it tearing easily, but I don't see this at all. Comes with a nice carrying case. I cut the velcro straps off, they just get in the way and I don't want them to rub against the paint. Great cover-will buy another as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: JaneAustenFan7373

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit, Failed after four uses
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 2016 Nissan Frontier SV. Very tight and challenging to get to fit over the truck. After 4 cycles of putting it on and back off - it ripped. Also, the product is like paper cloth and porous so leaves built up on the hood and over the bed - plus rainy season - resulting in dirt and stains on my freshly waxed truck. Kinda made the “truck cover” pointless... It mildly served it’s purposes of keeping the truck clean in the fall season, since it melt leaves off I guess, but won’t be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex H.

customer_reviews.title: Thin material but still performed
customer_reviews.text: Came thinner than expected and it is a little difficult to put on your car at first, especially when it is snowy/icy/wet out it just slides right off until you get one of the straps hooked on good enough to let you finish covering your vehicle. It is much easier and stress free if two people are putting it on together. The hook straps that are not very durable and one actually already broke off for me. Enjoyed the conveniece when I did not have to clean off my car after many Midwest snowstorms this winter thus far so I can't say this cover didn't do its job.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit on 2017 Honda Accord.  A deal at $29!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly as a dust cover inside the garage and it fits very snugly, even though it says it's 200" and my 2017 Honda Accord specs list the car at 195". Maybe it will stretch over time. Soft material, easy to put on with two people. It wouldn't work outside in the weather. Breathable. Nice indoor car cover and a heck of deal for $29! I'd buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Jack Sonnet

customer_reviews.title: Cover fits pretty well and lasted almost  a year before it fell apart in the Florida rain and sun
customer_reviews.text: Cover fit pretty well and lasted less than a year in the Florida heat and sun before it fell apart (about 10 months) it was reasonably priced at $32 when I bought it but then now I went to look at it and it’s $50 which I think is obviously about 20 bucks more don’t really think it’s worth it anymore. Went with a different manufacture this time.
customer_reviews.author: Rottie fan 77

customer_reviews.title: Great Car Cover
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this car cover for my 2017 Kia Forte because during the summer when my daughter isn't in school, I only drive my car once a week. My car was getting very dusty being parked for so long so I purchased this cover. I tested it out by washing my car and then putting the cover on it. So far the cover has kept my car clean and free of dust. When I do drive it I put the cover back on to maintain a dust free car. I am very happy I purchased this car cover.
customer_reviews.author: OC

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrates after 18 months of use
customer_reviews.text: This worked well at first, but after two summers in partial sun, the fabric (not woven cloth) disintegrated when washed -- tore like tissue paper. Fine for a short term use, but not up to long term sun exposure. Liked its fit and breathability. Well made but fabric (not woven cloth, just felted synthetic fiber) not durable enough. The fabric is probably how they can afford to offer the low price.
customer_reviews.author: efsch

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: This cover seems low quality. The problems I encountered were: * I ordered the right size for my car, but it was too small. * The reason I got this cover is because the car is parked under trees that drop pollen. The pollen goes right through this cover. * This cover has velcro straps on the front and the back sides that are supposed to secure it into place. The straps are made of a rough fabric that can scratch the car's paint, so they're worse than useless.
customer_reviews.author: Superfly

customer_reviews.title: Fits tight but fits
customer_reviews.text: A little tight fit for my 1978 Caballero Diablo, but will work Looks like it will handle strog wind without tearing like my alst cover did
customer_reviews.author: BUBBA GUMP

customer_reviews.title: Fits S550 Mustang (2015-2017) Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I keep my car garaged all winter and wanted a simple cover to prevent any accidental scratches and to keep dust and debris off my 2016 Mustang. This cover fits nearly perfectly without any tie downs and has a paint friendly lining. It will NOT do well outdoors in an uncovered setting and is NOT weatherproof. This cover is more of a dust cover for storing your vehicle indoors.
customer_reviews.author: epaminondas

customer_reviews.title: NICE COVER FOR THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you how pleased I am with this cover. Fits A 2008 Cadillac DTS like a glove! My car measures 215" nose to tail and though this cover says it fit's up to 228".. I don't know where the excess would come from.. since it just FITS nose to tail without any excess. Like how it almost totally covers the wheels as well. I would definitely buy again. Great as an indoor dust cover.. not sure how it would hold up to the elements outside, as it is pretty lightweight. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: K. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof at all
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product for the price, but not waterproof at all. In fairness I'm not sure it claims to be. I had to leave a car outdoors for a week while my garage was worked on, and unfortunately it rained a lot that week. After taking the cover off, the car was ugly dirty with lots of dusty residue from the rain. If it weren't for that, the cover would otherwise protect against bird poop, UV rays, etc. just not water. Cheap enough that you can replace every few years if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jaybird

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Horrible cover
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS COVER... I just opened it up and put on a 2019 chevy silverado. It is so thin you can see the truck under the cover. Also one of the velcro straps fell off right out of the bag. Also Amazon says it will fit up to up to 20'8". .( that's 248 inches). Another lie... my truck is 240" long and it will not even cover the bumpers. Completely different than what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good fit
customer_reviews.text: this fits my 2001 Camaro convertible nicely as long as there is no wind blowing. there's a wave runner with a cover next to it and that cover stays on while this one blows off front and back just the middle strap keeps it from coming all the way off it does keep the sun & leaves off of the car so it was worth getting. I'm thinking of putting tent stakes in the ground and using bungie cords to keep it on until i use the car.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great cover-Great price!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this car cover for my convertible beetle stored in the garage to keep it clean, dust free and covered. On those snowy Northeast Ohio days when I am outside snow blowing and the door is up it will stay dry. Great price and very easy for me to cover on my own without a 2nd person helping.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle P, Brunswick, Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Very good cover for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this cover for less than a month so I don’t know how durable it is and it doesn’t claim to be waterproof. But I am very pleased with the fit on my 1950 Dodge Coronet and it does provide protection against sun damage and bird droppings. We have had some high winds and it stays put. The strap and buckle that goes underneath the car secures it well I could have spent more money and bought a better cover, but for a low-priced cover I don’t think you’ll find a better one. I would definitely buy another.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Great basic car cover
customer_reviews.text: item arrived quickly & packaged well. I have a toyota camry & the cover fits very well. Love the wide belt that cinches on the underside. The buckles do not stay on the belt, but no problem in tying it together. Otherwise it seems to be well made. I don't know how long it will last yet, but I have had many others & it seems that none of them last long in the sun these days. Nothing fancy, but it does the job & I would recommend it to anyone interested
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Hallmark

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Car Cover
customer_reviews.text: This is a great car cover. I use the 200" one to cover my 2012 Mustang GT500, should fit the v6 and GT models too. I really appreciate that it has the under the car strap and elastic around the edges, keeps the cover from flying off in the wind, unlike my previous car cover.
customer_reviews.author: Pothen

customer_reviews.title: Very stiff bulky material.
customer_reviews.text: We Found this difficult to install and remove. Very bulky to store between use. Covers the car for sure but would only recommend for long term use, not daily. Too stiff stays wrinkled. Was looking for cover to keep our somewhat feral cat prints off the wife’s Lexus. Need to find something else. But it will keep paw prints off.
customer_reviews.author: H. Falter

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof but a good cover still
customer_reviews.text: The cover does what it says. It protects against the sun. I bought it to cover my car in the driveway under a tree from sap and sun. After a couple of weeks so being covered, I removed the cover to go for a drive. It had just finished raining a few days before. The water stains were clearly visible on the car but there is no sap stains. Not waterproof but does a good job protecting again the sun.
customer_reviews.author: A Samiian

customer_reviews.title: Very thin material, did not last year.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cover in October 2018, it has now ripped in multiple places and fallen off my small SUV, 1 month short of a year. I had noticed over the past 2 months, the material was deteriorating and leaving remnants on my truck. I removed the cover very few times, so the deterioration can be attributed to normal Virginia weather and poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the money!
customer_reviews.text: If I had paid $100+ for this, it would be a 3 star review max, but it was $22! Not meant for long term harsh weather storage, but it was only $22! For that, it does exactly what I need. Fits my 1990 Jaguar XJS V12 Convertible perfectly! If you need an inexpensive car cover delivered quickly, this is it! Kept my new toy covered while the custom one was made and delivered.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: size up
customer_reviews.text: I have a 78 GMC C15 that 195" long. Bought the 210" cover and couldn't get the cover over the rear tail lights without concern of ripping the cover. I returned and got the 232" cover and it just fits. Seems decently made for the price. Customer service was responsive but not greatly helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Noodle

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very lightweight cover, it will not protect the car against acorns or other falling debris...but it will keep trash from accumulating on the paint and staining it. Its breathable and lightweight easy to put over the car. It has a tie down at the rear that can be tied to your bumper hitch for security plus eyelets on the sides for an under the car security cable if you choose to use one. Fairly loose fit on my Subaru wagon except at the back its a bit tight. Acceptable for the low price. If it lasts a couple of years I will be happy.
customer_reviews.author: thomas womack

customer_reviews.title: Very Good for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I like that this fits, and it has 'bra' straps so that it will stay on my car. Comes shrink wrapped. I bought it to keep dust and cat paws off my car's finish. It does the job, and costs a heckuva lot less than others. Good quality too. Not thin, not thick, just right.
customer_reviews.author: A 1 LADY

customer_reviews.title: very thin, seems cheap
customer_reviews.text: I put it on the car and it was a snug fit but the Velcro "straps" don't fit anywhere that would allow me to use them to help tie down the cover. You have to cut the antenna hole yourself. Material seems like it will rip easy. Not sure it is worth anything yet. Will reevaluate in a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Mohler

customer_reviews.title: No-brainer purchase
customer_reviews.text: Really liked everythign about this purchase. The packaging was outstanding. Even within the amazon packaging. It looks like care and precision was put into shipping the product. Instructions were easy to follow. I didnt need them, but figured i would just look. The cover I purchased fit our '74 Vette PERFECTLY!. The material is actually superior for the price. No comparison to the stuff at the local parts store or department store. Would and will buy again for other vehicles we have.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFreak7395

customer_reviews.title: Hook and loop straps immediately detached from cover
customer_reviews.text: When unpacking the cover I pulled lightly on one of the straps and it immediately detached from the stitching on the cover. I placed the cover on the car using only the 3 remaining straps and with just light wind 2 other straps broke loose also. Very frustrating. I sewed the straps back on reinforcing the stitching and covered the car again and it has withstood a couple storms now. Apart from that the cover seems adequate and has withstood a couple months of rain, snow, ice and freezing weather.
customer_reviews.author: MZ

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed!
customer_reviews.text: I've read the reviews and saw the complaints about this cover. Guys, it costs ~$30, what do you expect?!!! I have trees that shed leaf "pods" in the spring and when the temperature hits about 70F the sap melts and sticks the pods to my paint. Nothing but mineral spirits and elbow grease removes the stains. I wanted a cover to keep the pods from my car and this worked perfectly. I will not be covering my car for extended periods in snow and rain. While I had it covered we had a very strong wind storm and the cover stayed perfectly in place. A Fastex style buckle would have been a nice feature for the bottom strap.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle Trate

customer_reviews.title: After you check your measurements, add a foot before buying.
customer_reviews.text: Does not really fit my Altima despite having checked measurements. Due to that can't tie it down at the rear as instructed and the trunk won't close with the tie inserted. It is also very cumbersome for one person.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is light weight, yet rugged and easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: This cover fits my Infiniti Q45 220 ft length comfortably and lives up to it's promise in all other respects. Yesterday we had one of Florida's typical windy and rainy Spring days, which proved to be a blustery gully washer down pour of a test, and it passed with flying colors. The under belly strap held it down firmly, and afterward found my car completely dry. I am confident that this cover will also provide the necessary protection from Florida's intense sun as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dave DeGeorge

customer_reviews.title: NOT waterproof
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT waterproof. I ordered 2 of them for my cars but I will be returning them both. I've only opened one and covered a car on my driveway but the first light rain soaked through it already. If you're just covering a car inside of the garage, this will be fine but I'd hardly call this outdoor water/weather proof.
customer_reviews.author: LT45

customer_reviews.title: Nice Car Cover But It's Not Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I use this cover for my 2013 Lexus GS350. The cover fits the car perfectly although it supposedly is 10" longer. So it's a good idea to buy this cover a little longer for a better fit. It was fairly easy to put on and it has elastic on each end and straps in each corner to assist in holding the cover in place. The only problem for me is that water goes right through. If that's not a problem for you then it's a good cover but it won't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer NY

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Got this cover to keep the tree sap off my car where I park in the shade. It's a nice cover and has elastic on both ends to fit and form to shape. I ordered the size recommended from the chart for my car model and it is plenty big. Better than too small though.
customer_reviews.author: Attention to Detail

customer_reviews.title: Started disinigrating after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in March, didn't last through summer before it started degrading. Today it is in absolute tatters. I'm in Southern California, so it didn't have to contend with snow and ice. Summer wasn't even that unusual, so it cannot protect itself from normal UV. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Trust Me

customer_reviews.title: Fabric could not stand up to sun.
customer_reviews.text: It protected the car from the sun, until it started to disintegrate after a few months. Then it started tearing in several places. I finally had to just throw it away. It might work well in a moderate climate, or indoors.
customer_reviews.author: Ginnygirl

customer_reviews.title: Great value and above expectation
customer_reviews.text: Used for three months so far in SOCAL weather and find the cover to be above expectation as far as quality, generic fit, resistance to water and dust. I can deploy it in 3 min and stow in 90 seconds (the storage bag it comes with is worthless). If you need a light duty car cover for light rain and the focus is dust and sun protection, this should do it. Fits a 2004 mustang Cobra Coupe with breathing room.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for outdoor use
customer_reviews.text: Really works! Sprinkler was getting the car every night and causing damage and this fixed it all!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Scott

customer_reviews.title: Less then half the price of an Audi cover
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cover because the wet leaves that land on my car leave a stain. I looked at an official Audi cover and it was more then double the price and back ordered. I am very happy with this for covering my car when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Florentine

customer_reviews.title: Just dont touch it....
customer_reviews.text: Its a decent cover for your car. I got this for a 68' Mustang and it fits perfectly the only problem is its already ripped.... A lot.... The car just sits in a corner away from people touching it and yet after a couple months its pretty much in 4 big pieces. Do yourself a favor and get a better quality one or if you do get this make sure its in doors or you'll end up wasting your money like I did.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.

customer_reviews.title: Fits Honda S2000
customer_reviews.text: The width is a little too wide for my car (there is excess you can wrap around the tires), but it is a universal car cover. It's been raining where I live and I noticed the front part that is snug to the car has a stain mark. Dont know if its from too much rain but the car itself is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandre G.

customer_reviews.title: Useless garbage
customer_reviews.text: Had this cover for only 3 months. Got my car detailed and It has been sitting on my car since I purchased it. Went to take it off for the first time the other day. It tore in two different places and there was tons of dirt underneath. The car is in a carport, so the cover doesn't even get direct sunlight or rain and it still tore
customer_reviews.author: Sam M.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: We don't have a garage, and I did not want to leave my new (used) car out in the sun because the paint is already 14 years old and it was previously garage-kept. This does a great job of keeping it from being pounded by the sun as well as free from pollen and tree droppings. Great price. Easy to roll up and stick in the bag. I had to get a shorter antenna so it would fit under the cover, but I like the new antenna better anyway.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: Have lasted quite a while in the CA sun. Easy to put on. Three straps have come loose from the fabric, actually worked in my favor since I now sinch it around the wheel and now the wind doesn't blow it off. The strap to tuck into the trunk is nice when it did blow off in the strong winds.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Not water proof but well made and useful
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed that water goes right through the material. They are lightweight and easy to use as a cover but should it rain, expect drips to the surface of the car. They have a nifty securing strap at the base and the material is very comfortable to handle and fold. The seams are well sewn and there is no chemical smell. No recommendation up or down.
customer_reviews.author: Peter DP

customer_reviews.title: Great small car cover, lots of tie downs
customer_reviews.text: So far this has held up quite well! Using it to cover a 1990 mazda rx7, a bit big for the car, but the number of tie down straps made it easy to secure. Has been hit with winds of 40+ so far and not budged, as well as held up good against some big rainstorms. Material feels good quality too!
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Leader doesn’t Last!
customer_reviews.text: There needs to be lifespan rating for covers! While at first glance these appear to be a decent value, and fit nice, I’ve bought two in 1.5 years and they deteriorate rapidly in Ca. sun, tearing and literally turning to dust. My car is covered only about half the time, covers lasted less than a year on the first one, and about 7 months on the second. They need to be reinforced, or thicker on the roof portion, as that’s where they always wear out. I would pay double or more the price for this feature, and would hope the cover would last at least 1.5 years or longer?
customer_reviews.author: Ron S.

customer_reviews.title: cheap car cover
customer_reviews.text: This cover lasted me 14 months, time to replace it with a higher quality cover. I live in California central valley where temperatures get very hot in the summer so I'm not disappointed but would like to get at least two years out of a car cover. Fit my camry and my mustang just fine. If you want a inexpensive cover that won't last very long I recommend this cover otherwise spend a little more cash and get a better quality cover for your prized possession.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is excellent quality for a very reasonable price. Has fasteners, etc as described. I haven't even ever put it on the car. It is so big, bulky and heavy. I can't manuever it. I wanted it for daily use but it is too cumbersome to pull out everyday. Would probably work better for long-term storage or 2 people putting it on. I can't get it back in the box or I would have returned it. It's taking up most of the space in the back of my suv. To be fair, alot of the problems are probably just me. A man could spread it out easily, I'm pretty sure.
customer_reviews.author: Jomama

customer_reviews.title: Not water resistant.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for my jaguar x-type. It fits snug but after trying to unfold it one of the straps tour off. I originally bought the product for sun protection because the sun vaporized the morning dew off my car and caused paint damage. The product is not water resistant, but has straps to keep the product from flying away. This product is helpful to keep sun damage from forming on the paint job of your car.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah Meachem

customer_reviews.title: Works as described has held up great!
customer_reviews.text: Update 10/21/18: It’s held up great through hot muggy summer days/thunder storms and most recently Hurricane Florence! I was a little skeptical based on the price and negative reviews, however I couldn’t be more satisfied with this product. If you’re looking for a reasonable price cover that will get the job done, look no further! Brought to cover 2002 Nissan Altima, great fit, holding up well thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Horrible protection
customer_reviews.text: This is the most horrible car cover I have ever bought. It is like a huge piece of paper, does not keep debri off your vehicle. The fires here caused a lot of ash to fall and the cover didn't even protect it from that.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I got it was to protect my car from morning dew. I used it twice. Both mornings, I was expecting to take it off and find a nice clean and dry car. Instead, I found it covered in water droplets almost as if nothing was on it. I am sending it back since it is basically useless.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: For the best fit do your own research.
customer_reviews.text: Even though Amazon said it wouldn't fit, this cover (205") is a perfect, snug fit for my 1986 XJ6 (199.6"). I'd advise anyone purchasing car covers from Amazon to check their car's dimensions (easiest on-line) and buy based on that information. I wouldn't buy a cover exactly the same length as the car. In my case, the extra inches made a perfect fit. I doubt it will blow off. The recommended size would have been far too big.
customer_reviews.author: JaguarOT

product_meta.title: Leader Accessories Car Cover UV Protection Basic Guard 3 Layer Breathable Dust Proof Universal Fit Full Car Cover Up To 200''
feature_bullets: ONE car cover in package-Size 199'' L x 61''W x 50.5''H . - Breathable material will keep your car dry
DUSTPROOF - Perfect for indoor and outdoor use. Protects for your vehicle from UV rays, dirt and dust
WINDPROOF- straps and buckle at the bottom to protect your car cover in heavy wind from blowing off
FITMENT- Elastic hem around the bottoms for snug fit. The below car models in description are for reference

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars3,517 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
